description: A collection of circles in a large triangular formation that curves slightly toward the right at the top; there is also a semicircular formation of circles that extends outwards from the right side of the top point of the triangular formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a yellowish-orange triangle in the center of the triangular formation and a dark green triangle toward the bottom left corner.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
